results.title: Deciding to organize
results.creator_credit: Bonnie Sherr Klein and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Organizing for Power”.
Produced as a part of the Challenge for Change Program, this series examines Saul Alinsky’s method of organizing communities into effective action units based on participation democracy. A group of concerned citizens from Dayton, Ohio, consult Alinsky on means of creating an effective organization.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bonnie Sherr Klein and National Film Board of Canada
results.description:
Episode of Series “Organizing for Power”.
Produced as a part of the Challenge for Change Program, this series examines Saul Alinsky’s method of organizing communities into effective action units based on participation democracy. A group of concerned citizens from Dayton, Ohio, consult Alinsky on means of creating an effective organization.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “Organizing for Power”.
Produced as a part of the Challenge for Change Program, this series examines Saul Alinsky’s method of organizing communities into effective action units based on participation democracy. A group of concerned citizens from Dayton, Ohio, consult Alinsky on means of creating an effective organization.

results.title: Our wonderful pa
results.brief_description: Lisa’s father was born in 1932 and died in 2003 of prostate cancer. This story is a tribute to a much-loved father and grandfather.

results.title: A Family story
results.brief_description: As a small child living in London Daphne witnessed the Blitz. This story is about Daphne’s life growing up in London in WW2 and her migration and settlement in Australia.

results.title: My grandfather, the spy
results.brief_description: It was wartime when Edwina’s grandfather met her grandmother. He had a toothache and met his wife to be at the front door. Her father was the local dentist. Edwina tells her grandfather’s extraordinary life story.

results.title: A Writer's legacy
results.brief_description: Heather’s father believed in his daughter as a writer even when she did not believe in herself. He left her letters and memorabilia but the real legacy her father left her was the love of writing.
results.description: Heather’s father believed in his daughter as a writer even when she did not believe in herself. He left her letters and memorabilia but the real legacy her father left her was the love of writing.

results.title: The Little Frenchman
results.brief_description: Roger was a widower with no living relatives or close friends. His life experiences placed him in both world wars and post war migration. This is his story.

results.title: Ordinary extraordinary stories
results.brief_description: Ordinary Extraordinary stories features a selection of digital stories produced as part of ACMI digital storytelling public workshop program. This collection celebrates the extraordinary stories of ordinary people. The stories are as diverse as the people who have created them

results.title: Ode to a shoebox
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Narada Lawson
results.brief_description: The outside walls of the housing commission flats were as grey as a winter’s day and as cold as charity. But inside was a warm world of fun, love an adventure. This is an account of living in public housing in Melbourne.
results.description: The outside walls of the housing commission flats were as grey as a winter’s day and as cold as charity. But inside was a warm world of fun, love an adventure. This is an account of living in public housing in Melbourne.
